intro: Psychotria refractiloba, commonly known as the "Cocaine Plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon basin. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, red berries that contain the alkaloid cocaine, which is extracted from the leaves. Due to its psychoactive properties, it is of significant botanical and pharmacological interest.
